body:
No, I don't see how that's true.

Say I have the hypothetical destructor trace:

```
- Top
  - A
    - A.1
  - B
```

Let's say Top exceeds the limit, so it is managing a queue.  Execution looks like:

```
- Delete Top
  - Push A to queue
  - Push B to queue
- Delete A
  - Push A.1
- Delete B!!!
- Delete A.1
```

This might be harmless but if this change in behavior was unintentional I would rather keep the stack discipline here.
